page.title: 04Housing, Faceby
page.content: {Planning.}The N.York Moors National Park is the planning authority as this is a conservation area. Some of its rulings are questionable, i.e., insistence on a two-storey building replacing a bungalow on exposed high ground. The local parish council can study applications and make recommend- ations.{Housing styles.}Faceby Lane leading into Carlton has, on one side, 14 council houses built in the 1940s and opposite these the Crescent, half of them elegant houses built early this century and, the other half, modern executive-type dwellings of the '70s and '80s. In Whorlton a local builder has skilfully blended matching stone in an extension to a cottage built in 1812. His family have been local stone-masons for more than two centuries, passing their skills from from father to son.
